Posts.Content: You are right, this does not sound good. Go to the emergency room, or your GP's surgery and demand to be seen. Refuse to leave. Sometimes you have to be the "squeaky wheel"! Good luck, Sera
Posts.Title: Just been diagnosed but got rash on one breast and worried

Posts.Content: Other people's results are meaningless to your situation. Go and get it checked out. There are so many things it can be that are more nuisance than anything else, and can be checked and fixed. Do not take chances out of fear PLEASE. Even if it is cancer, it can be cured if caught early. Sera
Posts.Title: Pea size lump on breast

Posts.Content: The black stuff is blood. Her cancer may have spread into her stomach lining, and the blood from that is partly digested. I am sorry for what you all are going through. Sera
Posts.Title: Black Vomiting

Posts.Content: This lump sounds like one of two things; a sebaceous cyst, or a lipoma, a fatty tumour. I had a sebaceous cyst just below my breast and it grew and got sore as it rubbed on my bra. It got to the size of a peanut and I had it removed. A lipoma is just oan overgrowth of fat cells forming a lump. Yeah, go and have it taken off, get it out of your life. PS I named mine Doris, the third breast,
Posts.Title: Lump that has changed

Posts.Content: There are some excellent images on the Net if you search breast ultrasound or breast sonogram. Sera.
Posts.Title: breast cancer what does it look like pictures of ultrasound

Posts.Content: My daughter at 18 came to me with a breast lump. I freaked out and we went to the doctor and he referred her to a surgeon. She put it off for a couple of weeks as she had an overseas holiday booked. (I stayed home and panicked quietly to myself). When she came back, it had grown to the size of a chicken nugget. The surgeon put her in for an op the next morning. It was a common-or-garden fibroma. I am sure your daughter has something like this. They grow quite suddenly and can get big quickly. I hope all is well. Sera.
Posts.Title: 18 year old has large lump in breast HELP Scared Mom 1 2

Posts.Content: They operated through my nipple. The tumour was 8cm, so pretty big. Goodness knows how long it was there. I think it gets to a certain size then presses on blood vessels. Anyway, I had a drain stuck in my nipple for 3 days, my poor husband nearly fainted at the sight of it. My surgeon who is a breast specialist told me that he sees 50-60 patients with what he called "nuisance" conditions before he sees any malignancies. He said that there are about 100 things that can happen to breasts and that basically cancer is the only life-threatening one. I had a more minor bleeding and crusting on the other side later, but that was a duct blocked with sebaceous gunk. Cheers, Sera
Posts.Title: Bleeding nipple on Right Breast with Suspicious Tumor

Posts.Content: There are many pesky things it could be, but it is also the first symptom of some very nasty diseases. Make an appointment with the doctor NOW, and get it examined. Sera
Posts.Title: Rash and hard breast

Posts.Content: It doesn't sound like cancer to me either. Mushy is good. I had breast surgery twice for odd things and the surgeon told me that 99% of breast conditions are just a nuisance, and there are many many lumpy conditions which are not cancer. Is it near the nipple or closer to the armpit. There are lots of glands in those two areas that can get lumpy for various reasons. Let us know what it turns out to be. sera
Posts.Title: Lump description...

Posts.Content: I had this in both breasts (not at the same time). The first one was a duct papilloma which I had removed. That required a drain tube for a couple of days and left a scar across my nipple. The other one was just the duct blocked and inflamed by dead cells that got trapped and that was a small surgery as well. My breast doctor at the time told me that he saw dozens of "nuisance" breast conditions for every cancer diagnosis he encountered. Good luck, Sera
Posts.Title: Bleeding from Nipple

Posts.Content: I had the same experience some years ago. I had surgery and it was a duct papilloma, a benign tumour situated inside the milk ducts. Like you I had had a recent mammography which was clear. Apparently a mammogram cannot show inside the ducts. Usually duct tumours, both benign and malignant are pretty slow about spreading outside the duct so you will just need the duct to be removed entirely to clear it up. Good luck, Sera
Posts.Title: Bleeding nipple on Right Breast with Suspicious Tumor

Posts.Content: Hi Sophie. The doctor first tried a needle extraction like yours did, and they said the same "it isn't a cyst, it is a growth". (FREAKED OUT MAMA) Then she went into hospital that afternoon (mainly because he had ops listed the next day), and removed it. They did an instant biopsy and by the time she came to, they were able to tell us it was a fibroma. It was very big, though, and it took quite a few years for her little breast to re-shape itself around the space. I am sure that your daughter is the same. These things are common at that age, although they may herald a lifetime of getting them from time to time. My sister had three altogether. Best wishes, Sera.
Posts.Title: 18 year old has large lump in breast HELP Scared Mom 1 2

Posts.Content: Good to hear from you. I don't think I would like to be awake either, although you probably won't feel a thing. It is good that they are taking all the ducts, it will give you peace of mind. Good luck and let us know how it goes. Sera
Posts.Title: Bleeding nipple on Right Breast with Suspicious Tumor

Posts.Content: Any changes in the breast or nipples need to be checked out. It could be anything or nothing, but I would want to get it looked at as soon as possible. Don't put it off, that is the bottom line, even if it is something, early treatment will get rid of it. I have had surgery on both of my nipples over the years, for duct papillomas. The sooner you do it, the smaller the scar. Sera
Posts.Title: Inverted nipple become un-inverted!

Posts.Content: It sounds like it is just you. I have had slightly inverted nipples since my teens. As to the discharge, it may simply be hormonal. I had surgery on a blocked duct years ago after a discharge from a nipple, but it was quite copious and bloodstained. Can you squeeze any out? It is not a bad idea to gave your breasts checked by a doctor to establish your baseline, then any changes can be picked up. It is reassuring that it is both nipples - the odds against getting a serious condition, eg cancer identically in both breasts are astronomical. Sera
Posts.Title: Inverted nipples ... Maybe cancer ... Scared, worried

Posts.Content: It could be an infected or blocked breast duct. There would not necessarily be heat from this, I had both sides get blocked up and it was just like this. That said, it is good that you are getting it checked out straight away. Sera
Posts.Title: Has anyone experienced similar symptoms?

Posts.Content: Exactly the same thing happened to my daughter at the age of 18. I can still remember the doctor's face after he had run his patronising number about panic and overreactions, when he felt the chicken-nugget sized lump in her breast. LOL. She was in surgery that afternoon and it was a fibroma.
Posts.Title: Teenage Daughter

Posts.Content: The MRI can see inside the breast duct, where the others cannot. This is where your problem lies, not out in the breast tissue. Sera
Posts.Title: What can an MRI see that mammo and U/S cant?

Posts.Content: It may take months to get a routine test done, but most, if not all, doctors will jump the queue for somebody with symptoms. Any discharge from the breast is cause for concern. I have had dark discharges from both breasts in the past, and it has been benign conditions both times. My breast doctor said to me that there were about ninety breast conditions, and only one of them was more that a "flaming nuisance". LOL, that cheered me up. You will worry, and I hope that it turns out OK for you. Statistics are on your side. Good luck, Sera.
Posts.Title: More lumps in breast with black discharge ..

Posts.Content: I had the same things once in each breast over the years. One turned out to be a duct papilloma, and the other was a duct blockage that caused a buildup of dead cells and got a bit inflamed. I don't think the tightening thing is too serious, it goes with monthly hormones. The breast surgeon whom I saw both times said that there were about 50-60 breast conditions that were more nuisance, to every case of actual cancer. My family's women reflect that, we have all had issues like this. Good luck, Sera
Posts.Title: New here with some strange symptoms...

Posts.Content: I agree. My sister and daughter both got these. My daughter's lump grew from a Lima bean to a chicken nugget in about a month. They are very common in teenagers and pretty harmless. They do grow so it is good to have it removed while it is still small (smaller scar, less breast lopsidedness). Cheers, Sera
Posts.Title: 20 year old daughter with breast lump - changing shape?

Posts.Content: My daughter had a similar lump at age 17. It was a fibroma (benign lump) which is very common. She still had to have it biopsied to make quite sure, but that was the end of it. Good luck, Sera
Posts.Title: Teenager with lump in breast

Posts.Content: Why don't you just put yourself out of your misery, and go and get a doctor to look at it? Breast cancer does not manifest itself like this...there is an inflammatory cancer that shows on the outside of the breast, but it involves redness, puckered skin and swelling and incredible pain. I don't think you have that. That said, everything should be checked out; a breast diseases specialist I went to told me that for every case of cancer, he saw at least 20 or 30 conditions that ranged from painful cysts to blocked milk ducts and every nuisance in between. Another thought, do you drive with a seatbelt on? Or carry a shoulder bag? The breast can be very sensitive to any minor knocks. Cheers, Sera
Posts.Title: Scared that bruises might be breast cancer

Posts.Content: If you have really dense breasts, it can hide a tumour. MRI will give a more thorough image of the breast, particularly in and around the ducts.
Posts.Title: What can an MRI see that mammo and U/S cant?
